newsitem.title: RUSSIA: UES shareholders to meet on bond issue Aug 26.
newsitem.headline: UES shareholders to meet on bond issue Aug 26.

text.p: The board of directors of Russian national electric company UES will call an extraordinary shareholders meeting on issuing convertible bonds on August 26, a senior company official said on Wednesday.
"There will be only one question on the agenda -- giving up the right of first refusal to buy shares," securities accounting director Vera Redko said. "The meeting will be on August 26."
She said the board had approved calling the meeting at its own meeting on Tuesday, and the company planned to announce the general meeting on Thursday.
Shareholders have the right to buy any newly-issued shares but would have to give up that right in the case of a bond which would convert into equity.
President Boris Yeltsin earlier on Wednesday signed a decree approving the convertible bond issue, which is likely to cover 1.5-5.0 percent of company shares and be issued in the autumn.
